summary: The Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board is the only federal agency that provides independent safety oversight at nuclear sites. The agency is headed by its Board with up to 5 members. But prior assessments described a deterioration in the agency's effectiveness that was largely driven by dysfunctional relationships among the Board members. title: Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board: Opportunities Exist to Further Improve Management and Planning
